clinical_study.brief_title: Loco-regional Complications of Pharyngitis in Children: a National Case-Control Study
clinical_study.official_title: Loco-regional Complications of Pharyngitis in Children: a National Case-Control Study

brief_summary.textblock: To study the association between several exposures of interest and the occurrence of infectious loco-regional complications of pharyngitis in children.

detailed_description.textblock:
Investigators will include in the study (after agreement of child and parents):
- Cases: children < 18 years old hospitalized for peripharyngeal suppurations, diffuse cervical cellulitis or cervical adenophlegmon in participating Ear, Nose & Throat (ENT) and pediatric departments.
- Controls: children < 18 years old with pharyngitis but without infectious complications recruited by general practitioners (GPs) or by primary care pediatricians in private setting, matched to cases by age, date of infectious complication (index date), delay between the pharyngitis and the index date and, if possible, the referring physician.
Assessment criterion: difference in the frequency of exposure to various factors among cases and controls during an a priori defined exposure window.
Several exposure of interest will be compared between cases and controls. One specific main exposure of interest during a predefined window of exposure has been defined but will not be revealed to investigators to avoid selection bias. Several secondary exposure of interest were a priori defined but will not be revealed to investigators to avoid selection bias.

primary_outcome.time_frame: from the date of diagnosis of pharyngitis up to 6 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Magnitude of the exposure of interest

arm_group.description: Cases: children with loco-regional complications of pharyngitis
Controls: children with pharyngitis but without infectious complications

intervention.description: Collection of data on clinical, bacteriological and computed tomography results and measurement some exposures during the month before the index date

study_pop.textblock: Cases: participating Ear, Nose & Throat (ENT) and pediatric departments Controls: recruited ''in office settings'' by general practitioners (GPs) or by primary care paediatricians

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
For all:
- children < 18 years old
- children living in Metropolitan France
- the parent understand French language and is able to answer to a telephonic interview
- at least one parent agree to participate
Cases: children hospitalized for peripharyngeal suppurations, diffuse cervical cellulitis or cervical adenophlegmon in participating Ear, Nose & Throat (ENT) and pediatric departments Controls: children with pharyngitis but without infectious complications recruited ''in town'' by general practitioners (GPs) or by primary care pediatricians, matched to cases by age, sex, the index date of infectious complication, delay between the pharyngitis and the index date and, if possible, the referring physician.
Exclusion Criteria:
- children (cases or controls) with renal failure, hemophilia, chronic thrombocytopenia or immunosuppression (constitutional or iatrogenic) at the time of pharyngitis
